kaapi_closure.h File Reference

Classes

class  RFO::ClosureAttribut
 Type of attribut for a closureThis type allows to code attribut for a closure on an 32 bits unsigned integer. Default attributs are stored from bit 0 to bit 2 :

  • bit0 is the stealable attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure could not be theft
  • bit1 is the uniqueness attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure execution should be unique [Not implemented]
  • bit2 is the local attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure should be steal only by local thread
  • bit3 is the site attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure has a site constraint
  • bit4 is the ocr attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure has an ocr mapping constraint The attribut may be extended by users: The representation is on 32 bits unsigned integer.
More...
class  RFO::BaseClosure
 A closure object is a call to a function. It is also called task.The closure is created to represent a computation. Using closure the users may split its works into subcomputation called closures. A closure has a runtime state that is inherited from Core::Condition which allows to defined five states, INIT, EXEC, STEAL, WAIT, and TERM. The state diagram is the following. Note that the state EXEC also represents closures that are ready and, at the end, terminated. More...
class  RFO::Closure
 A closure object is a call to a function. It is also called task.Closure of type Closure is based closure that can be pushed into Frame container. BaseClosure for the purpose of closure object. More...
